function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < count' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < count' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < count' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < count' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < count' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < count' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'argc' used after its definition?
Is variable 'argv' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'ages' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'argc' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'printf("---\n");' be considered dead code?
Is this statement not dead: “printf("%s is %d years old.\n", *(cur_name + i), *(cur_age + i));”?
